NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
January 28, 1958
OFFICE OF EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
14 GREGORY HALL
URBANA, ILLINOIS
Dr. Sam L. Becker
Chairmen, NAEB Research Committee
Division of Television, Radio, FM
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam:
What do you think of this? I wonder if the NAEB should join in this,
with you delegated as our representative? It would keep our hand in.
Since he was the only person we had on the spot, in Paris, at the
time, John Meaney represented us at this meeting. I think I sent you
a copy of an earlier note on this. Not sure he was greatly impressed,
but I'd think this has possibilities. But I’ll “quit pushin’" and let
you make up your own mind, and decide what we might do.
Thanks for your excellent telephoned suggestions of yesterday.
Annual total is now $87,700.00 including $15,000.00 for annual studies,
only $10,000.00 for Seminars and Workshops, and $20,000.00 Grants
in aid. Have listed coordinator (16,500.00: $15,000.00 and 10% re¬
tirement etc.) and assistant, ($7,000.00 and 10%) with $4,000.00
travel. Your suggestions,now incorporated, have strengthened the
whole request.
See copies of only 3 letters received to date on Nielsen proposal. I
wonder if we should now wait for their next year's study. I'll wait
for all replies, of course, but thought you might like to see these.
Sincerely,
Harry J. £>xornia
